definition: hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]
ring/hoop/loop/(chain) link/classifier for scores in archery etc/to surround/to encircle/to hem in

sentences.english: I cupped the deers muzzle in my hand and breathed into its hot mouth.
sentences.chinese: 我用手环住鹿的吻部，往它温热的嘴里吹气。

sentences.english: Electrostatic sensitive device inside, Please wear the anti-ESD ring before handing.
sentences.chinese: 内有静电敏感器件，接触设备前请戴上防静电手环。

sentences.english: Yesteray when I went shopping, I discovered bracelets are sold in Shanghai Giordano.
sentences.chinese: 昨天当我去逛街时，发现上海佐丹努正在销售手环。

sentences.english: Other non-profits use wristbands as complements to more prominent symbols of identity.
sentences.chinese: 还有一些非盈利组织使用手环来突出自己的表示。

sentences.english: Through the skin can be hand-hand ring, hand waving stick as good.
sentences.chinese: 可将手穿过皮手环，握杖挥动称为佳。

sentences.english: This idea was sparked by the rise in popularity of Livestrong bracelets.
sentences.chinese: 这一想法是因手环的流行激起的。

definition: (of a magnet) to attract metallic objects/(fig.) to exert a magnetic attraction (for investment, tourists etc)
